relating to the careful organization of a complicated activity: logistical support/problems Assigning an armed federal officer to every commercial flight would be a logistical nightmare. See
logistics
More examplesFewer examplesAirlines face a huge logistical challenge trying to get their stranded passengers to their destinations as well as to get their planes and crews to where they are needed.For five weeks, four devastating hurricanes made political trips impractical, both for logistical reasons as well as the risk of appearing callous.Even assuming that the logistical difficulties can be worked out, the company will face the toughest test of all: Will customers actually order orange slices in place of French fries?One reason for this is logistical, in that there is a low ratio of officers to members.

relating to the process of planning and organizing to make sure that resources are in the places where they are needed, so that an activity or process happens effectively: The system was incapable of handling the US Army's huge logistical needs. The Virginia-based company will provide maintenance and logistical support for the government project. The plans were changed for logistical reasons. logistical difficulties/hurdles/problemsa logistical headache/nightmare A delay in passing the law would cause a logistical nightmare for businesses.
